byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and JONATHAN GILBERT

abstract: Argentina offers to pay $6.5 billion to six hedge funds holding bonds that country defaulted on in 2011; deal, which has been accepted by two hedge funds so far, could end years of litigation.
lead_paragraph: Montreux Partners and Dart Management have agreed to take an offer made by the South American nation.

headline.main: Argentina Reaches Debt Deal With 2 Hedge Funds
headline.print_headline: After Lengthy Battle, Argentina Reaches Debt Deal With 2 Hedge Funds

snippet: Montreux Partners and Dart Management have agreed to take an offer made by the South American nation.
